definition: to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: As to reserving tickets, you need to talk to the Travel Department. Their number is 11111.
sentences.chinese: 至於訂票，你需要和差旅部門說一聲，他們的電話是。

sentences.english: To make sufficient use of the seats, Airlines companies always supply overbooking service.
sentences.chinese: 航空公司爲充分利用座位，往往會接受超額訂票。

sentences.english: Helli: ok give me a call so I can book tickets.
sentences.chinese: 好，隨時給我電話，我可以幫你訂票。

sentences.english: Check the Web site for tickets and more details.
sentences.chinese: 更多詳情和訂票請登錄我們的網站。

sentences.english: It is a popular show, so advance booking is essential.
sentences.chinese: 這是個很受歡迎的演出，所以一定要提前訂票。

sentences.english: Only those who had booked in advance were allowded in.
sentences.chinese: 只有那些預先訂票的人才可以進去。

sentences.english: Was the seat available and the sale recorded?
sentences.chinese: 那那到底這個座位是空的且訂票被記錄下來了嗎？

sentences.english: It is not allowed that different passengers use same ID number.
sentences.chinese: 如今體系不支持多個遊客用同一身份證訂票的值機。

sentences.english: The case study is an airline reservation system.
sentences.chinese: 這一案例研究的是一個航班訂票系統。

sentences.english: You can reserve tickets and collect them when you go.
sentences.chinese: 你可以訂票，然後在去看戲的時候取票。

sentences.english: Please read the attached file for details of ticket reservation.
sentences.chinese: 訂票詳情及辦法，請參閱附檔。

sentences.english: When we arrived there, they had closed the books.
sentences.chinese: 我們到那裏時，他們已停止訂票。

sentences.english: I’m calling to confirm your booking.
sentences.chinese: 我打電話來確認你的訂票。

sentences.english: This is my curriculum design, and aircraft booking system.
sentences.chinese: 這是我的課程設計，飛機訂票系統。

sentences.english: The reservation list for each coach will also be pasted on the train itself, next to the entrance door.
sentences.chinese: 當然每節車廂的入口處也會貼有訂票單。

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to place an order/to book ahead
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
official website (abbr. for 官方網站|官方网站[guan1 fang1 wang3 zhan4])
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
a pass (authority to enter)/a laissez-passer or safe conduct
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
